lexUnit.name: regret.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling of sorrow, repentance, or disappointment

sentence.text: I slumped to my knees , burdened by the hopeless regret that I had n't had the chance to do this just a bit sooner .
` Does your flippancy conceal a regret that those old times are gone forever ? "
For a moment animosity was swept away by mutual interest and , as she led him towards the recovery cage , she felt a pang of regret that their relationship could not be friendly .
Jane felt little regret about that .
` Now I just feel great regret at what has happened .
Whatever their regrets at the time , however , the Americans had certainly lost them by the early 1950s as they came increasingly to value the sterling area as a buffer for the dollar .
And if it is not ( and I will argue that it is not ) then to what extent does this tradition of anguished regret for the past hinder our actions in the present and in the future ?
And perhaps that was all she could hope , that her pain , her regret for what might have been , would be anaesthetised .
THE American film maker Woody Allen once said his one regret in life was that he was n't somebody else .
I should also convey the regrets of the hon. Member for Ashford ( Mr. Speed ) that he can not be present this evening .

There are no regrets about keeping Southall or Kizzy .
It reflects moral regret for having violated a situation of trust , and it shows concern that someone might have been hurt . "

Her only faint regret was that Jake would never know !
In spite of everything she felt regret .
I 'm still absolutely disgusted at what has happened , but the emotion is one of sadness and bitter regret rather than anger .
My chief regret in my stay at Transport was that we were not able to do more in combining private and public investment in partnership projects .

He has contemplated suicide , he says ; he feels deep regret about the death .
` It is my deepest regret that my dad was not spared to see , and enjoy , all that is happening to me . "
Audrey has no regrets about her decision , preferring to throw her energies into looking after children .
But I have no regrets about grabbing that ball to prevent a goal being scored against us in our World Cup tie in Berne .
Gray had no regrets over not joining Brian Little at Leicester City last summer .

` I have made this decision with some regret -- but not without a great deal of thought . "
With regret , he had had to ignore a taxi at the Coronet entrance ; just a minimal precaution .
Guillaume relinquished Modigliani as a client without too much regret .
In April 1975 , we abandoned London without regret , for our new life in the valleys .
She sighed without regret .
